urlText: Central Station: Changes to Platform 16 and 17
content:
From 18 May 2020 there will be changes to Platforms 16 and 17 at Central Station due to Sydney Metro construction works.

Hoarding for the Central Walk excavation work will move from the middle of the platform to the southern end of the platform. Temporary concrete ramps will be built to connect the existing platform floor surface and the new concrete floor surface areas.

For your safety, please move carefully along the platform and follow directions from staff.

If you are travelling to Central Station and require assistance to alight from Platforms 16 and 17, please board via the front door of the fourth train carriage.

For more information about the Sydney Metro construction works, visit sydneymetro.info.
subtitle: Central Station: Changes to Platform 16 and 17

urlText: Roseville Station Commuter Car Park temporary closure
content: From Monday 3 August 2020 the Roseville Station Commuter Car Park will be closed for approximately 16 months while station upgrades take place.
subtitle: Roseville Station Commuter Car Park temporary closure

urlText: Woy Woy Wharf temporary closure
content:
From Monday 3 August until until late December 2020, Woy Woy Wharf will be temporarily closed for upgrades.

Ferries will instead be using the commercial wharf, adjacent to Woy Woy public wharf.
subtitle: Woy Woy Wharf temporary closure

urlText: Fairy Meadow Station ramp access temporarily unavailable
content:
From Monday 10 August for approximately 10 weeks, there will be ‘stair access only’ to/from platform 1 at Fairy Meadow Station due to station upgrade works. Ramp access will not be available during this time.

Construction includes the building of new ramps and link bridges.

If you require ramp access you will be need to make alternative arrangements. 

For assistance please call Fairy Meadow Station on 02 4223 5582.
subtitle: Fairy Meadow Station ramp access temporarily unavailable

urlText: Central Station: Suburban Tunnel temporarily closed
content:
The Suburban Tunnel is temporarily closed for Sydney Metro construction works.

Access for Platforms 16 to 23 is only via the Northern Concourse or Southern Tunnel. View a map of Central station.
subtitle: Central Station: Suburban Tunnel temporarily closed

urlText: Inner West minor bus timetable changes
content:
From Sunday 25 October, there be minor changes to timetables on routes 308, 320, 406, 410, 415, 422, 425, 426, 430, 473, 476, 477, 478, 479, 490, 491, 492 and 526 to support changes to other services in the Inner West.

You will be able to plan your trip with the new timetables in the Trip Planner from Sunday 11 October.

content:
From Sunday 25 October, route 407 changes will see all services on this route operate via Newton Road throughout the week.

For more details see Inner West bus service changes.

You will be able to plan your trip with the new timetables in the Trip Planner from Sunday 11 October.

urlText: Route 413 changes from 25 October
content:
From Sunday 25 October, route 413 will gain additional services and be altered to end at Railway Square instead of Martin Place. To continue your journey to Martin Place you will be able to catch a train from Central Station or light rail from the Haymarket Light Rail stop.

For more details see Inner West bus service changes.

You will be able to plan your trip with the new timetables in the Trip Planner from Sunday 11 October.

urlText: Route 431 changes from 25 October
content:
From Sunday 25 October, there will be minor changes to the route 431 timetable on this route to improve reliability. The frequency of weekend trips will be adjusted to better reflect demand, with services operating every 12 minutes on Saturdays and 15 minutes on Sundays.

For more details see Inner West bus service changes.

You will be able to plan your trip with the new timetables in the Trip Planner from Sunday 11 October.

urlText: Route 436 will be withdrawn from 25 October
content:
From Sunday 25 October, route 436 will be withdrawn with services in Rodd Point and Haberfield replaced by the new route 437, which will run from Five Dock to the Queen Victoria Building via the City West Link.

If you are travelling from Rodd Point or Boomerang Street in Haberfield to Central Station or to a destination along Parramatta Road you can transfer to the 438X at Haberfield Shops or Leichhardt Market Place.

If you are travelling from Chiswick or Russell Lea towards Parramatta Road or Central Station can transfer from route 504 and transfer to route 438X at Wareemba or use a route 492 or 530 service on Lyons Road and transfer to 438X at Five Dock shops.

For more details see Inner West bus service changes.

You will be able to plan your trip with the new timetables in the Trip Planner from Sunday 11 October.
subtitle: Route 436 will be withdrawn from 25 October

urlText: Route 438 upgraded to 438X
content:
From Sunday 25 October, route 438 will be upgraded to become 438X, a new limited stops service, with buses operating at least every 10 minutes for most of the day, seven days a week.

During weekday peaks buses will operate around every 5 minutes, and evening services will operate every 15-30 minutes. Services on route 438X will be all stops from Abbotsford to Leichhardt Town Hall (Norton St), then Parramatta Road and Catherine Street, Parramatta Road and Johnston Street, Parramatta Road and Missenden Road (for RPA Hospital), Parramatta Road and Ross Street (for University of Sydney), Broadway Shopping Centre (Mountain Street/Victoria Park), Railway Square then all stops to Martin Place.

Early morning and late night services will operate as the all stops 438N (before 6am and after 10pm).
    
Route 438X and 438N replace routes 438 and L38.

For more details see Inner West bus service changes.

You will be able to plan your trip with the new timetables in the Trip Planner from Sunday 11 October.
subtitle: Route 438 upgraded to 438X

urlText: Route 439 will be withdrawn
content:
From Sunday 25 October, route 439 will be withdrawn and alternative services provided by routes 464, 502, 438X or 438N.
    
If you are travelling from Mortlake or Concord to the Sydney CBD you can use route 464 and transfer to a train service at Burwood Station.

If you are travelling from Cabarita, Concord and Canada Bay towards Leichhardt or the Sydney CBD you can use route 502 and transfer to a route 438X service at Ramsay Road in Five Dock.

During weekday peaks, from Cabarita, Concord and Canada Bay you can travel directly to the Sydney CBD via Victoria Road on route 502.

If you are travelling between Five Dock, Haberfield and Leichhardt to the Sydney CBD you can use route 438X.

For more details see Inner West bus service changes.

You will be able to plan your trip with the new timetables in the Trip Planner from Sunday 11 October.
subtitle: Route 439 will be withdrawn

Martin Place Station, Elizabeth St, Sydney

urlText: Route 461 upgraded to route 461X
content:
From Sunday 25 October, route 461 will be upgraded to become route 461X, a new limited stops service, with buses operating at least every 15 minutes for most of the day, seven days a week. During weekday peaks buses will operate around every 10 minutes. Evening services will operate every 15-30 minutes.

Services on route 461X will be all stops from Burwood Station to Parramatta Road and Catherine Street, then stop only at Parramatta Road and Johnston Street, Parramatta Road and Missenden Road (for RPA Hospital), Parramatta Road and Ross Street (for University of Sydney), Broadway Shopping Centre (Mountain Street/Victoria Park), Railway Square, then all stops to the Domain.
    
Early morning and late night services will operate as an all stops 461N.

Route 461X and 461N replaces route 461.

For more details see Inner West bus service changes.

You will be able to plan your trip with the new timetables in the Trip Planner from Sunday 11 October.
subtitle: Route 461 upgraded to route 461X

destination.name: Riley St opp Kennedy St, Woolloomooloo

urlText: Route 464 additional services from 25 October
content:
From Sunday 25 October, route 464 will gain additional weekly services.

This route will also replace all route 466 services between Burwood, Enfield, Croydon Park and Ashfield.
    
The frequency of services on weekdays and Saturdays will be improved with a bus every 15 minutes during the day (around every 10 minutes during weekday peaks), while the frequency of Sunday services will be improved to 20 minutes. Evening services will run every 30 minutes.

For more details see Inner West bus service changes.

You will be able to plan your trip with the new timetables in the Trip Planner from Sunday 11 October.
subtitle: Route 464 additional services from 25 October

destination.name: Whittaker St at Tennyson Rd, Mortlake
Trinity Grammar School, Victoria St, Summer Hill

urlText: Route 466 service changes from 25 October
content:
From Sunday 25 October, route 466 will be altered to run between Cabarita Park and Burwood only, no longer operating to or from Ashfield.

During peak periods the service will run between Cabarita and Burwood via Bayview Park. The route will be altered to operate direct via Ian Parade instead of Concord shops. Existing school service extensions to and from Strathfield Station will be maintained.

During weekday off-peak periods, evenings and on weekends, services will operate between Bayview Park and Burwood only.

Route 464 will provide alternative full time services between Concord, Burwood, Enfield, Croydon Park and Ashfield, while route 502 will provide alternative full time services between Cabarita Wharf, Concord, Five Dock and Drummoyne, with services extending to and from the Sydney CBD during weekday peak periods.

For more details see Inner West bus service changes.

You will be able to plan your trip with the new timetables in the Trip Planner from Sunday 11 October.
subtitle: Route 466 service changes from 25 October

destination.name: Santa Sabina College, The Boulevarde, Strathfield

urlText: Route 480 service changes from 25 October
content:
From Sunday 25 October, the frequency of route 480 services will be changed to every 60 minutes during weekday off peak and Saturdays to reflect demand.

For more details see Inner West bus service changes.

You will be able to plan your trip with the new timetables in the Trip Planner from Sunday 11 October.
subtitle: Route 480 service changes from 25 October

urlText: Route 502 service changes from 25 October
content:
From Sunday 25 October, route 502 will gain additional weekly services.

The route will also be altered to operate between Cabarita Wharf and Drummoyne via Concord and Five Dock seven days a week. The route in Five Dock will be changed to operate via Fairlight Street and Ingham Avenue, instead of via Park Road, First Avenue and Heath Street.

During the weekday peaks services will continue to operate to and from the Sydney CBD via Victoria Road. There will also be extra services either side of the morning and evening peaks with services departing the Sydney CBD until 8.30pm.

If you are in Bayview Park travelling towards the Sydney CBD can use route 466 then transfer to route 502 at Crane Street in Concord.

For more details see Inner West bus service changes.

You will be able to plan your trip with the new timetables in the Trip Planner from Sunday 11 October.
subtitle: Route 502 service changes from 25 October

urlText: F4 Cross Harbour ferry route changes
content:
From Sunday 25 October the F4 Cross Harbour route will be divided into two new routes, the F4 Pyrmont Bay and F9 Watsons Bay routes, to improve service reliability.

There will be no changes to timetables.

Find out more about these changes.

urlText: Central Station: Changes to Platforms 20 and 21
content:
From Monday 11 October, there are changes to Platforms 20 and 21 at Central Station due to Sydney Metro construction works.

Hoarding for the Central Walk excavation work has moved from the middle of the platform to the southern end of the platform. Temporary concrete ramps connect the existing platform floor surface and the new concrete surface areas.

For your safety, please move carefully along the platform and follow directions from staff. If you are travelling to Central Station and require assistance to alight from Platforms 20 and 21, please board via the front door of the fourth train carriage. For more information about the Sydney Metro construction works visit sydneymetro.info.
subtitle: Central Station: Changes to Platforms 20 and 21

urlText: Central Station: Southern Concourse temporary closure
content:
From 17 October the Southern Concourse at Central Station will be temporarily closed for Sydney Metro works.

To access platforms 4 to 12 travel via the Northern Concourse.

See a map and other information about Central Station

For more information about Sydney Metro works visit sydneymetro.info.

urlText: Central escalator outage (no. 1/2/3/4) between platforms 24/25 and concourse
content: From 18 October to mid-December 2020, the north escalator from the concourse to Platforms 24 and 25 (Town Hall end) will be temporarily closed for maintenance works. To access platforms 24 and 25 travel down the concourse to the lift or use the south escalator to Platforms 24 and 25 (Redfern end). You can view a map of the station here https://transportnsw.info/document/4930/central-station-map.pdf. If you need assistance, see station staff or call 9379 1777.
subtitle: Central escalator outage (no. 1/2/3/4) between platforms 24/25 and concourse

urlText: Rockdale lift outage - between concourse and Princes Highway
content: The lift between the concourse and Princes Highway is temporarily out of service. For assistance, ask staff or call 9563 7574.
